intro: Pfaffia fruticulosa var. fruticulosa, commonly known as curaçao root, is a perennial shrub native to the Caribbean islands. It is characterized by its woody stems, lance-shaped leaves, and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces small, round, orange-red fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its traditional medicinal uses, it is sometimes cultivated for its purported health benefits.
